answers.answer: I forgot to include in my post that I had another eye examination this afternoon, results were far more surprising than what i have found out last friday:R: -0.25 - 0.75 (astigmatism)L:  -0.25 - 0.50 (astigmatism)Last friday's results:R: -2.00 - 0.75 (astigmatism)L: -1.50 -0.50 (astigmatism)Last december's results:R: -1.50 - 0.25 (astigmatism)L: -1.00the doctor told me that the prescription wont go down once it is more than 100, but i was surprised to see the results this afternoon with -0.25 for both eyes compared from last friday's results.. Is this normal? Does it happen to other people?The doctor told me not to wear my eyeglases anymore because i would be over-corrected, but my vision is blurry.  I dont understand why is it like this.please help me..thanks!maio27Thanks again...

Vision does not vary that much in such a short time normally. One thing we think of is diabetes and ifyou have diabetes in your family or symptoms such as fatigue, weight loss, blurred vision, increased thirst or urination you need blood work to rule on diabetes.I sugeest you see an Ophthalologist eye MD. Specifically ask for a post cycloplegic refraction. This is done after the pupil dilates and prevents the RX from being made too strong.Find an eye MD near you at www.aao.orgJCH MD

Thank you so much Dr. John.I'm only 27, is it possible to have diabetes at my age? Yes, diabetes runs in the family.  My mother had diabetes, and so does her siblings.  Both of their grandparents also had diabetes.I'll be visiting an opthalmologist this week..
Sure diabetes occurs at your age so called Type I juvenile diabetes. Uusally there are symptoms like weight loss, thirst, increase urination, loss of energy. A blood test can rule it out.JCH MD
Thank you so much for the information.Doe that mean that I also need to see an endocrinologist/diabetologist to confirm this?thanks for the prompt answers..maio27
No any MD can do the test called a hemoglobin a1c testJCH MD

question: Hi,I have been using correctional eyeglasses.  Last december, I observed that I always have bad headaches whenever I use my eyeglasses. I went to the opto to have my eyes checked and I was precribed with a -1.00 for the left eye and -1.50 for the right eye with 25 astigmatism.I have been wearing the eyeglasses with the new lens for more than a month ( had my checkup last December 13, 2008).  About 2 weeks ago, I have observed that my left eye seemed blurry.  Last week I have the same headaches that I had last month, most especially if i wear my eyeglasses.  Since friday, I opted not to wear it because it feels much better (headaches is milder) when im not wearing one.  I had my eye checkup last saturday and found out that my left eye is now -1.50 with 50 astigmatism, and right eye is -2.00 with 75 astigmatism.  I have read somewhere that usually it takes about 6 months for that change to happen instead of less than a month or so..If thats the case, is it possible that my vision is degrading very fast and that is it possible for me to need to change my lenses monthly? What might be the cause of this?By the way, I am a web developer.  My job requires me to be working on the computer for 8-10 hrs daily.  I am  using an LCD monitor and I've had my lenses coated for UV protection.Thanks!
title: Unusual vision problem
